page.title: 12Transport
page.content: Stackpole is not well served by public transport.Only one service bus runs to Pembroke each week, on Friday afternoon.In the last six years it has been possible to use the school bus on Monday,Wednesday and Friday after it has dropped the children at the school in Stackpole.It is also possible on these days to catch the school bus from Pembroke to the village in the afternoon.These buses seldom carry more than one or two passengers and are usually empty. There is a volunteer car care system for emergencies such as visits to the doctor or the hospital in Pembroke Dock.This scheme is underused as it only operates infrequently. Single women without cars rely upon friends or relatives to drive them to town.
